p: Herd immunity in foxes is dynamic as a result of demographic processes, declining by more than half following entry of juvenile foxes into the population following the birth pulse. Influxes of new susceptible individuals may result in isolated infections becoming rapidly reconnected with susceptible hosts and transmission maintained in the absence of adequate immunity [ 5]. Our analyses of vaccination suggest that herd immunity is only maintained through regular ORV campaigns due to high population turnover. This may also have important implications for other wildlife diseases with marked birth pulses [ 45].
